alert.note: Alert for Custer (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 7:22PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Custer County through 800 PM CDT... At 722 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Arnold, or 16 miles east of Stapleton, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Arnold, Callaway, Pleasant Hill, Pressey State Wildlife Management Area, Milldale, Finchville and Lodi. This includes Highway 92 between mile markers 247 and 260. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for central Nebraska.
